VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on 05/19/2025. The previous audit
was completed in 2024 and no CAP was required. Chief administrator reviewed
client and employee files during this period. The agency had one unplanned
discharge due to a youth experiencing a mental health crisis and did not return to
the facility.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were completed with four staff members. Each staff member reported
things are going great. They had two youth who entered the program at the
beginning of this year. Two staff members started off as interns and were promoted
to full-time employees.
There are no youth at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the entire facility was completed. The facility was well
maintained, clean, and well organized. All bedrooms in use had appropriate
bedding. The bathrooms were viewed to have running water, working toilets,
working sinks, and working showers. The kitchen was clean and menu was posted.
3

All client files and medications were locked up. Basement was also viewed that
contained a washer and dryer. There were no safety concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
